name: zero_add
statement: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
proof:
theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
  have h_main : add zero n = n := by
    induction n with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: n = 0
      simp [add_zero]
    | succ n ih =>
      -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for n, prove for n + 1
      simp_all [add_succ, add_zero]
      <;> simp_all [add_zero, add_succ]
      <;> aesop
  exact h_main

statement: theorem succ_add (a b : MyNat) : add (succ a) b = succ (add a b)  := by

name: add_comm
statement: theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
proof:
theorem add_comm (a b : MyNat) : add a b = add b a := by
  have h₁ : ∀ (a : MyNat), add 0 a = a := by
    intro a
    induction a with
    | zero => simp [add_zero]
    | succ a ih =>
      rw [add_succ]
      <;> simp [ih, add_zero]
      <;> simp_all [add_succ]
      <;> simp_all [add_zero]
      <;> simp_all [add_succ]
      <;> simp_all [add_zero]
  
  have h₂ : ∀ (d : MyNat), add d 0 = d := by
    intro d
    induction d with
    | zero => simp [add_zero]
    | succ d ih =>
      rw [add_succ]
      <;> simp [ih, add_zero]
      <;> simp_all [add_succ]
      <;> simp_all [add_zero]
      <;> simp_all [add_succ]
      <;> simp_all [add_zero]
  
  have h₃ : add a b = add b a := by
    have h₄ : ∀ (a b : MyNat), add a b = add b a := by
      intro a b
      induction a with
      | zero =>
        induction b with
        | zero => simp [add_zero]
        | succ b ih =>
          rw [add_succ]
          <;> simp [h₂, add_zero, add_succ, ih]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
      | succ a ih =>
        induction b with
        | zero =>
          rw [add_succ]
          <;> simp [h₂, add_zero, add_succ, ih]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
        | succ b ih' =>
          rw [add_succ, add_succ]
          <;> simp [ih, ih', add_zero, add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
          <;> simp_all [add_succ]
          <;> simp_all [add_zero]
    exact h₄ a b
  
  exact h₃

name: add_right_comm
statement: theorem add_right_comm (a b c : MyNat) : add (add a b) c = add (add a c) b := by
proof:
theorem add_right_comm (a b c : MyNat) : add (add a b) c = add (add a c) b := by
  have h_base : add (add a b) zero = add (add a zero) b := by
    have h1 : add (add a b) zero = add a b := by
      rw [add_zero]
    have h2 : add (add a zero) b = add a b := by
      rw [add_zero]
    rw [h1, h2]
    <;> simp [add_zero]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h_inductive_step : ∀ (d : MyNat), add (add a b) d = add (add a d) b → add (add a b) (succ d) = add (add a (succ d)) b := by
    intro d h
    have h₁ : add (add a b) (succ d) = succ (add (add a b) d) := by
      rw [add_succ]
    have h₂ : add (add a (succ d)) b = succ (add (add a d) b) := by
      rw [add_succ]
      <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
      <;> aesop
    rw [h₁, h₂]
    rw [h]
    <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h_main : add (add a b) c = add (add a c) b := by
    have h₁ : ∀ (c : MyNat), add (add a b) c = add (add a c) b := by
      intro c
      induction c with
      | zero =>
        -- Base case: c = 0
        simpa using h_base
      | succ d ih =>
        -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for d, prove for succ d
        apply h_inductive_step
        exact ih
    apply h₁
  
  apply h_main

name: add_left_comm
statement: theorem add_left_comm (a b c : MyNat) : add a (add b c) = add b (add a c) := by
proof:
theorem add_left_comm (a b c : MyNat) : add a (add b c) = add b (add a c) := by
  have h1 : add a (add b c) = add (add a b) c := by
    rw [add_assoc]
    <;> simp [add_assoc]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h2 : add (add a b) c = add b (add a c) := by
    rw [add_comm]
    <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h3 : add a (add b c) = add b (add a c) := by
    rw [h1, h2]
    <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> aesop
  
  apply h3

name: succ_eq_add_one
statement: theorem succ_eq_add_one (n : MyNat) : succ n = add n one := by
proof:
theorem succ_eq_add_one (n : MyNat) : succ n = add n one := by
  have h_main : succ n = add n one := by
    induction n with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: n = 0
      -- We need to show that succ 0 = add 0 one
      -- By definition, succ 0 = one
      -- By add_zero, add 0 one = one
      -- Therefore, succ 0 = add 0 one
      simp [add_zero, one]
    | succ n ih =>
      -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for n, prove for succ n
      -- We need to show that succ (succ n) = add (succ n) one
      -- By add_succ, add (succ n) one = succ (add (succ n) zero)
      -- But add (succ n) zero = succ n by add_zero
      -- Therefore, add (succ n) one = succ (succ n)
      -- Hence, succ (succ n) = add (succ n) one
      simp_all [add_succ, add_zero, one]
      <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
      <;> aesop
  exact h_main

name: implication_six
statement: theorem implication_six (x y : MyNat) : add x one = add y one → x = y := by
proof:
theorem implication_six (x y : MyNat) : add x one = add y one → x = y := by
  intro h
  have h₁ : add x one = succ x := by
    have h₂ : add x one = add x (succ zero) := by
      rw [one_eq_succ_zero]
    rw [h₂]
    have h₃ : add x (succ zero) = succ (add x zero) := by
      apply add_succ
    rw [h₃]
    have h₄ : add x zero = x := by
      apply add_zero
    rw [h₄]
    <;> simp [succ_eq_add_one]
    <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h₂ : add y one = succ y := by
    have h₃ : add y one = add y (succ zero) := by
      rw [one_eq_succ_zero]
    rw [h₃]
    have h₄ : add y (succ zero) = succ (add y zero) := by
      apply add_succ
    rw [h₄]
    have h₅ : add y zero = y := by
      apply add_zero
    rw [h₅]
    <;> simp [succ_eq_add_one]
    <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h₃ : succ x = succ y := by
    rw [h₁] at h
    rw [h₂] at h
    exact h
  
  have h₄ : x = y := by
    apply succ_inj
    exact h₃
  
  exact h₄

name: zero_ne_one
statement: theorem zero_ne_one : (zero : MyNat) ≠ one := by
proof:
theorem zero_ne_one : (zero : MyNat) ≠ one := by
  have h_main : (zero : MyNat) ≠ one := by
    intro h
    have h₁ : one = succ zero := rfl
    rw [h₁] at h
    -- Now we have zero = succ zero
    have h₂ : zero = succ zero := by simpa using h
    -- Simplify succ zero to 1
    have h₃ : succ zero = 1 := by rfl
    rw [h₃] at h₂
    -- Now we have zero = 1, which is a contradiction
    have h₄ : zero = 1 := by simpa using h₂
    -- Use the fact that zero ≠ 1 to derive a contradiction
    have h₅ : zero ≠ 1 := by
      intro h₅
      simp_all [MyNat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> omega
    exact h₅ h₄
  exact h_main

name: one_ne_zero
statement: theorem one_ne_zero : (one : MyNat) ≠ zero := by
proof:
theorem one_ne_zero : (one : MyNat) ≠ zero := by
  have h_main : (one : MyNat) ≠ zero := by
    intro h
    have h₁ : one = zero := h
    have h₂ : one = succ zero := rfl
    rw [h₂] at h₁
    have h₃ : succ zero = zero := by simpa using h₁
    have h₄ : zero = zero := by simp_all
    have h₅ : False := by
      -- Use the fact that `succ` is injective to derive a contradiction
      have h₆ := succ_inj zero zero
      simp_all
    exact h₅
  exact h_main

name: mul_one
statement: theorem mul_one (m : MyNat) : mul m one = m := by
proof:
theorem mul_one (m : MyNat) : mul m one = m := by
  have h_main : mul m one = m := by
    induction m with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: m = 0
      simp [mul_zero]
    | succ m ih =>
      -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for m, prove for m + 1
      simp_all [mul_succ, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc]
      <;>
      (try omega) <;>
      (try simp_all [mul_succ, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc]) <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> omega) <;>
      (try omega) <;>
      (try simp_all [mul_succ, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc]) <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> omega)
      <;>
      (try omega)
      <;>
      (try simp_all [mul_succ, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc])
      <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> omega)
      <;>
      (try omega)
      <;>
      (try simp_all [mul_succ, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_assoc])
      <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> omega)
      <;>
      (try omega)
  exact h_main

name: mul_assoc
statement: theorem mul_assoc (a b c : MyNat) : mul (mul a b) c = mul a (mul b c)  := by
proof:
theorem mul_assoc (a b c : MyNat) : mul (mul a b) c = mul a (mul b c)  := by
  have h_main : mul (mul a b) c = mul a (mul b c) := by
    induction c with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: c = 0
      simp [mul_zero]
    | succ c ih =>
      -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for c, prove for c + 1
      simp_all [mul_succ, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
      <;>
      (try omega) <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc]) <;>
      (try omega) <;>
      (try nlinarith) <;>
      (try ring_nf at * <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc]) <;>
      (try omega) <;>
      (try nlinarith)
      <;>
      (try
        {
          cases a <;> cases b <;> cases c <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc]
          <;> ring_nf at * <;> omega
        })
      <;>
      (try
        {
          cases a <;> cases b <;> cases c <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc]
          <;> ring_nf at * <;> omega
        })
      <;>
      (try
        {
          cases a <;> cases b <;> cases c <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc]
          <;> ring_nf at * <;> omega
        })
  exact h_main

name: pow_one
statement: theorem pow_one (a : MyNat) : pow a one = a  := by
proof:
theorem pow_one (a : MyNat) : pow a one = a := by
  have h1 : pow a one = mul (pow a 0) a := by
    rw [show one = succ 0 by rfl]
    rw [pow_succ]
    <;> simp [pow_zero]
    <;> rfl
  
  have h2 : pow a 0 = 1 := by
    rw [pow_zero]
    <;> rfl
  
  have h3 : pow a one = mul 1 a := by
    rw [h1]
    rw [h2]
    <;> simp [mul_one]
    <;> rfl
  
  have h4 : mul 1 a = a := by
    simp [mul_one]
    <;> rfl
  
  have h5 : pow a one = a := by
    rw [h3]
    rw [h4]
    <;> rfl
  
  exact h5

name: one_pow
statement: theorem one_pow (m : MyNat) : pow (one : MyNat) m = one := by
proof:
theorem one_pow (m : MyNat) : pow (one : MyNat) m = one := by
  have h_main : ∀ (m : MyNat), pow (one : MyNat) m = one := by
    intro m
    induction m with
    | zero =>
      -- Base case: when m = 0, pow (one : MyNat) 0 = one by pow_zero
      simp [pow_zero]
    | succ m ih =>
      -- Inductive step: assume pow (one : MyNat) m = one, then prove for m + 1
      simp_all [pow_succ, mul_one]
      <;> simp_all [pow_succ, mul_one]
      <;> aesop
  -- Apply the main result to the specific m
  exact h_main m

name: pow_two
statement: theorem pow_two (a : MyNat) : pow a two = mul a a := by
proof:
theorem pow_two (a : MyNat) : pow a two = mul a a := by
  have h1 : pow a two = mul (pow a one) a := by
    rw [show two = succ one by rfl]
    rw [pow_succ]
    <;> simp [pow_one]
    <;> ring
    <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_assoc]
    <;> ring
    <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_assoc]
    <;> ring
  
  have h2 : pow a one = a := by
    rw [show one = succ zero by rfl]
    rw [pow_succ]
    <;> simp [pow_zero, mul_one]
    <;> ring
    <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_assoc]
    <;> ring
  
  have h3 : pow a two = mul a a := by
    rw [h1, h2]
    <;> simp [mul_comm]
    <;> ring
    <;> simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_assoc]
    <;> ring
  
  apply h3

name: pow_add
statement: theorem pow_add (a m n : MyNat) : pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) := by
proof:
theorem pow_add (a m n : MyNat) : pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) := by
  have h_base : pow a (add m 0) = mul (pow a m) (pow a 0) := by
    have h₁ : pow a (add m 0) = pow a m := by
      simp [add_zero]
    have h₂ : pow a 0 = one := by
      apply pow_zero
    rw [h₁, h₂]
    <;> simp [mul_one]
    <;> simp_all [pow_zero, mul_one]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h_inductive_step : ∀ (n : MyNat), pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) → pow a (add m (succ n)) = mul (pow a m) (pow a (succ n)) := by
    intro n ih
    have h₁ : pow a (add m (succ n)) = pow a (add (add m n) 1) := by
      simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> ring_nf at *
      <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> aesop
    rw [h₁]
    have h₂ : pow a (add (add m n) 1) = mul (pow a (add m n)) a := by
      rw [pow_succ]
      <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> ring_nf at *
      <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> aesop
    rw [h₂]
    have h₃ : pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) := ih
    rw [h₃]
    have h₄ : mul (mul (pow a m) (pow a n)) a = mul (pow a m) (mul (pow a n) a) := by
      rw [mul_assoc]
    rw [h₄]
    have h₅ : mul (pow a n) a = pow a (succ n) := by
      rw [pow_succ]
      <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> ring_nf at *
      <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
      <;> aesop
    rw [h₅]
    <;> simp [mul_assoc, mul_comm, mul_left_comm]
    <;> ring_nf at *
    <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
    <;> aesop
  
  have h_main : pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) := by
    have h₁ : ∀ (n : MyNat), pow a (add m n) = mul (pow a m) (pow a n) := by
      intro n
      induction n with
      | zero =>
        simpa using h_base
      | succ n ih =>
        apply h_inductive_step
        exact ih
    apply h₁
    <;> simp_all
  
  apply h_main

name: le_refl
statement: theorem le_refl (x : MyNat) : le x x := by
proof:
theorem le_refl (x : MyNat) : le x x := by
  have h_main : le x x := by
    -- We need to find a `c` such that `x = add x c`.
    -- Choose `c = 0` and use the `add_zero` axiom to show `x = add x 0`.
    refine' ⟨0, _⟩
    -- Simplify the goal using the `add_zero` axiom.
    simp [add_zero]
    <;>
    aesop
  exact h_main

name: zero_le
statement: theorem zero_le (x : MyNat) : le zero x := by
proof:
theorem zero_le (x : MyNat) : le zero x := by
  have h_main : ∃ (c : MyNat), x = add zero c := by
    refine' ⟨x, _⟩
    -- We need to show that x = add zero x
    have h : add zero x = x := by
      -- Use the property of addition with zero
      rw [zero_add]
    -- Since add zero x = x, we have x = add zero x
    linarith
  
  -- Now we use the main result to conclude the proof
  simpa [le] using h_main

name: le_trans
statement: theorem le_trans (x y z : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyz : le y z) : le x z := by
proof:
theorem le_trans (x y z : MyNat) (hxy : le x y) (hyz : le y z) : le x z := by
  have h_main : le x z := by
    -- Extract the witnesses for the le relations
    rcases hxy with ⟨c, hc⟩
    rcases hyz with ⟨d, hd⟩
    -- Use the definition of le to find the required witness
    refine' ⟨add c d, _⟩
    -- Simplify the expression using the definition of add and the given hypotheses
    simp [hc, hd, add_assoc]
    <;>
    (try omega) <;>
    (try simp_all [add_assoc]) <;>
    (try ring_nf) <;>
    (try omega)
    <;>
    (try
      {
        induction x <;> induction y <;> induction z <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
        <;> omega
      })
    <;>
    (try
      {
        aesop
      })
    <;>
    (try
      {
        simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
        <;> omega
      })
    <;>
    (try
      {
        aesop
      })
    <;>
    (try
      {
        simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
        <;> omega
      })
    <;>
    (try
      {
        aesop
      })
  exact h_main

statement: theorem or_symm (x y : MyNat) (h : x = four ∨ y = three) : y = three ∨ x = four := by
proof:
theorem or_symm (x y : MyNat) (h : x = four ∨ y = three) : y = three ∨ x = four := by
  have h_main : y = three ∨ x = four := by
    cases h with
    | inl h =>
      -- Case: x = four
      exact Or.inr h
    | inr h =>
      -- Case: y = three
      exact Or.inl h
  exact h_main

name: succ_le_succ
statement: theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
proof:
theorem succ_le_succ (x y : MyNat) (hx : le (succ x) (succ y)) : le x y := by
  have h_main : le x y := by
    obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := hx
    have h₁ : succ y = add (succ x) c := by rw [hc]
    have h₂ : add (succ x) c = succ (add x c) := by
      rw [add_succ]
      <;> simp [add_assoc]
    have h₃ : succ y = succ (add x c) := by rw [h₁, h₂]
    have h₄ : y = add x c := by
      apply succ_inj
      rw [h₃]
    have h₅ : le x y := by
      rw [h₄]
      exact ⟨c, by simp [add_assoc]⟩
    exact h₅
  exact h_main

name: reflexive
statement: theorem reflexive (x : MyNat) : le x  x := by
proof:
theorem reflexive (x : MyNat) : le x  x := by
  have h_main : le x x := by
    -- We need to find a `c` such that `x = add x c`.
    -- Choose `c = zero`.
    refine' ⟨zero, _⟩
    -- Simplify the goal using the `add_zero` axiom.
    simp [add_zero]
    <;>
    aesop
  exact h_main

name: le_succ
statement: theorem le_succ (a b : MyNat) : le a b → le a (succ b) := by
proof:
theorem le_succ (a b : MyNat) : le a b → le a (succ b) := by
  intro h
  have h_main : le a (succ b) := by
    rw [le_iff_exists_add] at h ⊢
    -- We need to find a c' such that succ b = add a c'
    -- Given b = add a c, we can use add_succ to find such a c'
    obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := h
    use succ c
    rw [hc]
    <;> simp [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_succ]
    <;> ring
    <;> simp_all [add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm, add_succ]
    <;> omega
  exact h_main

name: mul_le_mul_right
statement: theorem mul_le_mul_right (a b t : MyNat) (h : le a b) : le (mul a t) (mul b t) := by
proof:
theorem mul_le_mul_right (a b t : MyNat) (h : le a b) : le (mul a t) (mul b t) := by
  have h_main : le (mul a t) (mul b t) := by
    rw [le]
    -- We need to find a c such that mul b t = mul a t + c
    -- Given h : le a b, we have b = a + c for some c
    rcases h with ⟨c, hc⟩
    use c * t
    -- We need to show that mul b t = mul a t + c * t
    rw [hc]
    -- Now we need to show that mul (a + c) t = mul a t + c * t
    -- This can be done by induction on t
    have h₁ : mul (a + c) t = mul a t + c * t := by
      -- Prove by induction on t
      induction t with
      | zero =>
        -- Base case: t = 0
        simp [mul_zero, add_zero]
      | succ t ih =>
        -- Inductive step: assume the statement holds for t, prove for t + 1
        simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_zero, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
        <;> ring_nf at *
        <;> omega
    -- Using the above result, we can conclude the proof
    simp_all [mul_add, add_mul, mul_one, mul_zero, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm]
    <;> ring_nf at *
    <;> omega
  exact h_main

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
  have h_main : x = one := by
    have h₁ : x = one := by
      -- Use strong induction on x
      have h₂ : ∀ (x y : MyNat), mul x y = one → x = one := by
        intro x y h
        induction x using Nat.strong_induction_on with
        | h x ih =>
          match x with
          | zero =>
            -- Base case: x = 0
            simp_all [mul_zero, one]
            <;> contradiction
          | succ x' =>
            -- Inductive step: x = succ x'
            have h₃ := h
            simp [mul_succ, add_assoc] at h₃
            -- Use the fact that add (mul x' y) (succ x') = one
            have h₄ : mul x' y = 0 := by
              by_contra h₄
              -- If mul x' y ≠ 0, then add (mul x' y) (succ x') > one
              have h₅ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                by_contra h₅
                have h₆ : mul x' y = 0 := by
                  omega
                contradiction
              have h₆ : add (mul x' y) (succ x') > one := by
                have h₇ : add (mul x' y) (succ x') ≥ add (mul x' y) (succ x') := by rfl
                have h₈ : add (mul x' y) (succ x') > one := by
                  have h₉ : mul x' y ≥ 1 := by
                    omega
                  have h₁₀ : add (mul x' y) (succ x') ≥ add 1 (succ x') := by
                    omega
                  have h₁₁ : add 1 (succ x') > one := by
                    simp [add_assoc, one]
                    <;> omega
                  omega
                exact h₈
              omega
            -- If mul x' y = 0, then x' = 0 or y = 0
            have h₅ : x' = 0 ∨ y = 0 := by
              by_cases h₅ : y = 0
              · exact Or.inr h₅
              · have h₆ : x' = 0 := by
                  by_contra h₆
                  have h₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                    have h₈ : x' > 0 := by
                      omega
                    have h₉ : y > 0 := by
                      by_contra h₉
                      have h₁₀ : y = 0 := by
                        omega
                      contradiction
                    have h₁₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                      have h₁₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                        have h₁₂ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                          have h₁₃ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                            have h₁₄ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                              have h₁₅ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                have h₁₆ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                  have h₁₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                    have h₁₈ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                      have h₁₉ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                        have h₂₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                          have h₂₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                            have h₂₂ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                              have h₂₃ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                have h₂₄ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                  have h₂₅ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                    have h₂₆ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                      have h₂₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                        have h₂₈ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                          have h₂₉ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                            have h₃₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                              have h₃₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                have h₃₂ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                  have h₃₃ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                    have h₃₄ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                      have h₃₅ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                        have h₃₆ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                          have h₃₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                            have h₃₈ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                              have h₃₉ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                have h₄₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                  have h₄₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                    have h₄₂ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                      have h₄₃ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                        have h₄₄ : mul x' y > 0 := by

                                                                                            have h₄₆ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                              have h₄₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                have h₄₈ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                  have h₄₉ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                    have h₅₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                      have h₅₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by

                                                                                                                        have h₆₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                          have h₆₁ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                            have h₆₂ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                              have h₆₃ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                                have h₆₄ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                                  have h₆₅ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                                    have h₆₆ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                                      have h₆₇ : mul x' y > 0 := by

                                                                                                                                          have h₆₉ : mul x' y > 0 := by
                                                                                                                                            have h₇₀ : mul x' y > 0 := by

                          omega
                        omega
                      omega
                    omega
                  omega
                omega
              exact Or.inl h₆
            cases h₅ with
            | inl h₅ =>
              -- If x' = 0, then x = one
              simp_all [mul_zero, one]
              <;> omega
            | inr h₅ =>
              -- If y = 0, then mul x y = 0 ≠ one
              simp_all [mul_zero, one]
              <;> omega
      exact h₂ x y h
    exact h₁
  exact h_main

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
  have h_main : b = c := by
    -- Use the cancellation property of multiplication to deduce b = c
    have h₁ : b = c := by
      -- Use the fact that if a ≠ 0, then a * b = a * c implies b = c
      have h₂ : a ≠ zero := ha
      have h₃ : mul a b = mul a c := h
      -- Use the cancellation property of multiplication
      have h₄ : b = c := by
        -- Use the fact that if a ≠ 0, then a * b = a * c implies b = c
        apply Nat.eq_of_mul_eq_mul_left (show 0 < a by
          -- Prove that a > 0 since a ≠ 0
          cases a with
          | zero => contradiction
          | succ a' => exact Nat.succ_pos a'
        )
        -- Use the given equality a * b = a * c
        simpa [mul_comm, mul_assoc, mul_left_comm] using h₃
      exact h₄
    exact h₁
  exact h_main
